intro: Scabiosa purpurea, commonly known as the sweet William, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Scabiosa purpurea is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
